answers.answer: Hi.  Congratulations on your pregnancy!  One thing to remember about blood sugar is that exercise will make your blood sugar lower without the need for insulin.  Adrenaline causes your muscles to absorb glucose from your blood stream without needing insulin, and the effects from that adrenaline can last for a couple hours.  Hard and sustained exercise like swimming can most definitely cause the lows you are seeing.  Eating more and more often would definitely be a benefit to you.I have never heard of, nor can find any information on there being any higher chance than normal that your child will be hypoglycemic.  With any diabetes (or hypoglycemia), there appears to be a genetic component, but it also doesn't appear that the genetics always causes the condition.

question: I am currently 24 weeks pregnant & last week I had my 2nd hypoglycemic incident in a month.  The strange thing was that it happened 10 minutes after I ate a meal.  I have never had that happen before, it is usually if I haven't eaten enough.  The other noght before bed, my blood suager was 39 & tonight about 1 hour after eating & a 1/2 hour of swimming laps it was 76.  My doctor wants me eating every 2 hours & says I should be eating more protein.So, my question is since high blood sugar has an effect on fetuses & produces heaveir babies, can the same be said with people with low blood sugar?  Is my baby going to be hypoglycemic too or have problems when she is born?  I am a little worried because both my mother & her mother have type 2, which I believe is not heriditary, right?
title: Low blood sugar & pregnancy
